content: The best way to predict the future is to create it.
author: Peter Drucker

content: Do what you can, with what you have, where you are.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

content: Believe you can and you're halfway there.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

content: The best way to predict the future is to create it.
author: Peter Drucker

content: Do what you can, with what you have, where you are.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

content: Believe you can and you're halfway there.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

content: Success is not final, failure is not fatal: it is the courage to continue that counts.
author: Winston Churchill

content: It always seems impossible until it's done.
author: Nelson Mandela

content: In the middle of every difficulty lies opportunity.
author: Albert Einstein

content: Happiness depends upon ourselves.
author: Aristotle

content: You miss 100% of the shots you don’t take.
author: Wayne Gretzky

content: Act as if what you do makes a difference. It does.
author: William James

content: Well done is better than well said.
author: Benjamin Franklin

content: Don’t wait. The time will never be just right.
author: Napoleon Hill

content: Be yourself; everyone else is already taken.
author: Oscar Wilde

content: A room without books is like a body without a soul.
author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

content: What lies behind us and what lies before us are tiny matters compared to what lies within us.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

content: All that we are is the result of what we have thought.
author: Buddha

content: Do what you feel in your heart to be right – for you’ll be criticized anyway.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

content: If you want to lift yourself up, lift up someone else.
author: Booker T. Washington

content: Opportunities don't happen, you create them.
author: Chris Grosser

content: Keep your face always toward the sunshine—and shadows will fall behind you.
author: Walt Whitman

content: He who opens a school door, closes a prison.
author: Victor Hugo

content: Doubt kills more dreams than failure ever will.
author: Suzy Kassem

content: Do not go where the path may lead, go instead where there is no path and leave a trail.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

content: It is never too late to be what you might have been.
author: George Eliot

content: You must be the change you wish to see in the world.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

content: Don’t count the days, make the days count.
author: Muhammad Ali

content: Quality means doing it right when no one is looking.
author: Henry Ford

content: Success usually comes to those who are too busy to be looking for it.
author: Henry David Thoreau

content: Don’t be afraid to give up the good to go for the great.
author: John D. Rockefeller

content: Hardships often prepare ordinary people for an extraordinary destiny.
author: C.S. Lewis

content: The only place where success comes before work is in the dictionary.
author: Vidal Sassoon

content: Do what you love and the money will follow.
author: Marsha Sinetar

content: Your time is limited, so don’t waste it living someone else’s life.
author: Steve Jobs

content: I attribute my success to this: I never gave or took any excuse.
author: Florence Nightingale

content: Nothing will work unless you do.
author: Maya Angelou

content: The mind is everything. What you think you become.
author: Buddha

content: Courage is grace under pressure.
author: Ernest Hemingway

content: Don’t let yesterday take up too much of today.
author: Will Rogers

content: Everything you’ve ever wanted is on the other side of fear.
author: George Addair

content: Tough times never last, but tough people do.
author: Robert H. Schuller

content: The way to get started is to quit talking and begin doing.
author: Walt Disney

content: Either you run the day, or the day runs you.
author: Jim Rohn

content: Knowing is not enough; we must apply. Willing is not enough; we must do.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

content: The most difficult thing is the decision to act, the rest is merely tenacity.
author: Amelia Earhart

content: I have not failed. I've just found 10,000 ways that won't work.
author: Thomas Edison

content: If you’re going through hell, keep going.
author: Winston Churchill

content: Opportunities multiply as they are seized.
author: Sun Tzu

content: A goal properly set is halfway reached.
author: Zig Ziglar

content: Failure is another stepping stone to greatness.
author: Oprah Winfrey

content: Difficulties in life are intended to make us better, not bitter.
author: Dan Reeves

content: Go confidently in the direction of your dreams. Live the life you have imagined.
author: Henry David Thoreau

content: Fall seven times and stand up eight.
author: Japanese Proverb

content: Your attitude, not your aptitude, will determine your altitude.
author: Zig Ziglar

content: What you do today can improve all your tomorrows.
author: Ralph Marston

content: The best revenge is massive success.
author: Frank Sinatra

content: When you know what you want, and you want it bad enough, you’ll find a way to get it.
author: Jim Rohn

content: Don’t be pushed by your problems. Be led by your dreams.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

content: A smooth sea never made a skilled sailor.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

content: If opportunity doesn’t knock, build a door.
author: Milton Berle

content: Act as if what you do makes a difference. It does.
author: William James

content: You must expect great things of yourself before you can do them.
author: Michael Jordan

content: We may encounter many defeats but we must not be defeated.
author: Maya Angelou

content: It’s not about ideas. It’s about making ideas happen.
author: Scott Belsky

content: Don’t let the fear of losing be greater than the excitement of winning.
author: Robert Kiyosaki

content: You only live once, but if you do it right, once is enough.
author: Mae West

content: Believe you can and you're halfway there.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

content: Try not to become a person of success, but rather try to become a person of value.
author: Albert Einstein

content: The greatest glory in living lies not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall.
author: Nelson Mandela

content: Success is how high you bounce when you hit bottom.
author: George S. Patton

content: Don’t cry because it’s over, smile because it happened.
author: Dr. Seuss

content: Do one thing every day that scares you.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

content: Dream as if you’ll live forever. Live as if you’ll die today.
author: James Dean

content: Life is 10% what happens to us and 90% how we react to it.
author: Charles R. Swindoll

content: To avoid criticism, say nothing, do nothing, be nothing.
author: Elbert Hubbard

content: Start where you are. Use what you have. Do what you can.
author: Arthur Ashe

content: Don’t wish it were easier. Wish you were better.
author: Jim Rohn

content: He who has a why to live can bear almost any how.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

content: Everything has beauty, but not everyone can see.
author: Confucius

content: We are what we repeatedly do. Excellence, then, is not an act, but a habit.
author: Aristotle

content: Do what you can, with what you have, where you are.
author: Theodore Roosevelt
